main_definition: Peers refer to individuals of the same age, status, or ability.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Comrades or associates who are in a similar social position or rank.
meanings_and_examples.example: The business partners worked closely together as peers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Individuals of the same age group, typically teenagers or young adults.
meanings_and_examples.example: High school students often form close bonds with their classmates who are their peers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Members belonging to a similar social class or rank within an organization.
meanings_and_examples.example: As lawyers, they had many colleagues whom they considered as their professional peers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: People with equal levels of experience or skill in a particular field.
meanings_and_examples.example: The award recognized the achievements of authors who are his equals and peers in literature.
